item.title: Engie 董事长称，尽管美国出台了政策，但人工智能需求仍推动太阳能发展
item.description: Engie SA 董事长让-皮埃尔-克拉马迪厄（Jean-Pierre Clamadieu）周五表示，尽管与人工智能相关的电力需求激增将继续支持风能和太阳能发电场，但政策的不确定性正在阻碍对美国能源项目的投资。【原文：Policy uncertainty is deterring investment in US energy projects, though surging power demand tied to artificial intelligence will continue to support wind and solar farms, Engie SA Chairman Jean-Pierre Clamadieu said Friday.】

item.title: 卢拉表示，巴西将利用石油利润资助能源转型
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva）表示，巴西正计划建立一个机制，利用石油收入为国家的能源转型提供资金。【原文：Brazil is planning to create a mechanism to use oil revenues to finance the nation’s energy transition, President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said, as the country juggles its green ambitions against its expanding production of fossil fuels.】

item.title: 各国誓言建立全球低排放天然气市场
item.description: 英国、日本、德国和其他国家周五签署了一项声明，旨在支持全球天然气市场使用经认证的甲烷排放量较低的天然气，这对渴望将捕捉这种会导致地球变暖的污染的投资货币化的石油公司来说是一个潜在的推动力。【原文：The UK, Japan, Germany and other countries on Friday signed a declaration aimed at supporting a global market for natural gas that’s been certified to have lower methane emissions, a potential boost to oil companies eager to monetize investments in capturing the planet-warming pollution.】

item.title: 据说欧盟和中国将加入巴西领导的碳市场联盟
item.description: 欧盟和中国同意与巴西结成联盟，旨在加强碳市场方面的合作；这是南美国家在 COP30 气候峰会上带来的主要创新之一。【原文：The European Union and China agreed to join Brazil in a coalition aimed at improving collaboration on carbon markets — one of the main innovations the South American nation is bringing to the COP30 climate summit.】

item.title: 比尔-盖茨投入 14 亿美元帮助农民适应极端气候
item.description: 亿万富翁、慈善家比尔-盖茨正在投入资金，帮助小规模农户适应气候变化，解决粮食生产资金缺口问题。【原文：Billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates is pouring money into helping small-scale farmers adapt to climate change and address a gap in funding for food production.】

item.title: 特朗普将于下月拍卖整个海湾地区的石油和天然气钻探权
item.description: 特朗普政府计划在下个月拍卖墨西哥湾大约一半地区的海上钻井权，这是该地区 30 次此类租约拍卖中的第一次。【原文：The Trump administration plans to auction offshore drilling rights across roughly half of the Gulf of Mexico next month, the first of 30 such lease sales in the area.】

item.title: 西班牙在气候谈判中支持征收私人飞机和公务舱税
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sánchez）周五概述了对商业航班和私人飞机征税的计划。【原文：Spain’s Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez on Friday outlined plans to tax commercial flights and private jets, an initiative meant to combat planet-warming pollution from aviation that could hike the cost of business travel.】

item.title: 世界银行称飓风过后牙买加巨灾债券有望获得全额赔付
item.description: 据世界银行称，在飓风梅利莎引发全面触发事件后，牙买加巨灾债券的投资者现在面临着 100% 的赔付。【原文：Investors in Jamaica’s catastrophe bond now face a 100% payout after Hurricane Melissa set off a full trigger event, according to the World Bank.】

item.title: 缔约方大会气候峰会上会发生什么？这次峰会会有所作为吗？
item.description: 三十年来，联合国每年都会召开一次气候峰会，称为 COP，即缔约方大会。代表们从世界各地来到选定的城市，试图找到预防或减轻全球变暖最坏影响的方法。【原文：For three decades, the United Nations has been holding an annual summit on the climate known as COP, which stands for Conference of the Parties. Delegates travel to a chosen city from around the world to try to find ways to prevent or mitigate the worst effects of global warming.】

item.title: 巴西森林基金获得首批认捐
item.description: 世界各国领导人将在巴西举行峰会的第二天会议，讨论他们的气候承诺。这次会议是为主要活动做准备：COP30 将于周一拉开帷幕，届时将有数千名代表来到亚马逊参加为期两周的谈判。【原文：World leaders are set to meet for day two of a summit in Brazil to discuss their climate commitments. The meeting is a setup for the main event: COP30, which kicks off Monday and will draw thousands of delegates to the Amazon for two weeks of negotiations.】

item.title: 越南咖啡种植大省躲过最严重台风袭击
item.description: 越南最大的咖啡生产省份达乐似乎躲过了台风 "卡尔梅吉 "最严重的袭击。【原文：Vietnam’s biggest coffee-producing province of Dak Lak appears to have dodged the worst of Typhoon Kalmaegi, according to initial assessments by an industry group after the storm made landfall overnight.】

item.title: 欧盟森林法实施后，印尼将目光投向非洲北部的农场出口
item.description: 据一位高级政府官员称，印度尼西亚正在为其小规模咖啡和可可种植者寻找包括北非在内的新市场，因为根据欧盟新的森林砍伐规定，这些种植者有可能失去进入欧盟市场的机会。【原文：Indonesia is scouting fresh markets including North Africa for its small-scale coffee and cocoa farmers at risk of losing access to the European Union under the bloc’s new deforestation rules, according to a senior government official.】

item.title: 克里斯-萨卡的风险投资公司正在募集第二个融合基金
item.description:
这位科技界的亿万富翁说，需要下一代核技术来满足人工智能日益增长的能源需求和空调需求。【原文：

The tech billionaire said the next-generation nuclear technology is needed to meet the growing energy demand from artificial intelligence and need for air conditioning.

】

item.title: 沃尔玛继承人家族办公室投入 1 亿美元用于债务转换
item.description: 沃尔玛公司继承人本-沃尔顿（Ben Walton）的家族办公室佐玛实验室（Zoma Lab）已承诺向一家新机构提供 1 亿美元的资金，以扩大所谓的债务转换市场，帮助气候和环境项目融资。【原文：Zoma Lab, the family office of Walmart Inc. heir Ben Walton, has committed $100 million to a new facility to expand the market for so-called debt swaps designed to help finance climate and environmental projects.】

item.title: 挪威为森林基金认捐 30 亿美元，但附带条件
item.description: 只要巴西能够说服其他各方做出承诺，挪威承诺在 10 年内为一个旨在支持保护全球濒危森林的重要基金提供约 30 亿美元的贷款。【原文：Norway pledged about $3 billion in loans over 10 years for a key fund designed to support the conservation of endangered forests worldwide, as long as Brazil can convince other parties to stump up commitments.】

item.title: 新加坡傅说，COP30气候转型会谈显示出乐观态度
item.description: 新加坡可持续发展与环境部长 Grace Fu 表示，在 COP30 气候峰会上，负责确保摒弃化石燃料的过渡惠及所有人的小组内部的早期讨论是 "积极的"。【原文：Early discussions have been “positive” within the group tasked with ensuring transition away from fossil fuels benefits all people at the COP30 climate summit, according to Grace Fu, Singapore’s Minister for Sustainability and the Environment.】

item.title: 整个八月份全球温度比前工业时代高出 1.4 摄氏度
item.description: 根据世界气象组织的数据，8月份的全球气温比工业时代之前的平均气温高出1.4摄氏度，这使得2025年有望成为有记录以来最热的年份之一。【原文：Global temperatures through August were 1.4C higher than the average before the industrial age, putting 2025 on track to be one of the hottest years on record, according to the World Meteorological Organization.】

item.title: 欧盟立法者计划推动延长新碳市场的延迟时间
item.description: 一群欧盟立法者正在推动将该集团的碳市场限额交易系统推迟至少三年，这可能会对该地区的绿色议程造成又一次打击。【原文：A group of European Union lawmakers is pushing to postpone the bloc’s carbon market cap-and-trade system by at least three years, potentially dealing another blow to the region’s green agenda.】

item.title: 美国人正在搬离洪水易发地区
item.description:
在大流行病期间，居民大量涌入，但现在一些风险最高的县的居民正在减少。【原文：

After seeing an influx of residents during the pandemic, some the riskiest counties are now losing residents.

】

item.title: 特斯拉联合创始人的关键矿物工厂开始生产
item.description:
随着特斯拉联合创始人的电池回收商新工厂的开业，它也在向更广泛的买家出售重要的矿产品，因为电动汽车市场将出现下滑。【原文：

As the Tesla co-founder’s battery recycler opens a new facility, it’s also selling critical minerals to a wider set of buyers as the EV market is set to decline.

】

item.title: 欧盟委员会建议对 ESG 投资规则进行重大调整
item.description: 欧盟委员会正在提议对集团的《环境、社会和公司治理投资规则》进行重大修改，以解决自 2021 年推出该法规以来一直困扰资产管理行业的问题。【原文：The European Commission is proposing significant changes to the bloc’s ESG investing rulebook to fix problems that have plagued the asset management industry since the regulation’s rollout in 2021.】

item.title: 气候市长为何对美国大选感到振奋？
item.description: 当唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在他的第一个任期内将美国从《巴黎协定》中除名时，市长们纷纷承诺减少他们城市的排放量。这一次，同样的模式正在上演；周二美国大选的结果让全世界的市长们感到谨慎乐观。【原文：When Donald Trump removed the US from the Paris Agreement in his first term, mayors jumped in with pledges to cut their cities’ emissions. The same pattern is unfolding this time around — and the results of Tuesday’s US elections have mayors around the world feeling cautiously optimistic.】

item.title: 新研究显示海底采矿如何破坏食物网
item.description:
科学家们分析了试验采矿作业的数据，记录了对金枪鱼等具有商业价值的海产品的健康至关重要的小型海洋生物所面临的威胁。

。【原文：

Scientists analyzed data from a test mining operation to document threats to small marine organisms key to the health of commercially valuable seafood like tuna.

】

item.title: 由于 1.5C 目标渐行渐远，世界主要领导人跳过了 COP30 峰会前的会谈
item.description:
在巴西贝伦举行的联合国气候峰会之前，与会者寥寥无几，给高级别会议蒙上了阴影。【原文：

Lackluster attendance mars the high-level gathering ahead of the UN climate summit in Belém, Brazil.

】

item.title: 爱马仕联合首席执行官称，经理人正因环境、社会和公司治理而失去授权
item.description: 联邦爱马仕公司（Federated Hermes Inc.【原文：Money managers that retreat from sustainable investment pledges are increasingly being turned away when they pitch themselves to major asset owners in Europe, according to the chief executive of Federated Hermes Inc.】

item.title: 在卡塔尔和美国的威胁下，欧盟发出灵活执行 ESG 规则的信号
item.description: 欧洲发出信号，表示愿意接受国际社会对其环境、社会和公司治理规则的担忧，因为该集团面临着来自美国和卡塔尔的威胁。【原文：Europe signaled it’s willing to accommodate international concerns about its ESG rules, as the bloc fields threats from the US and Qatar.】

item.title: 汇丰银行称石油和天然气交易在能源组合中将 "大幅下降
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）预计，石油和天然气交易在其能源投资组合中的比重将有所下降，因为可再生能源有望成为为人工智能数据中心供电的首选方式。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc is expecting oil and gas deals to make up a smaller part of its energy portfolio, as renewables look to be the preferred way to feed data centers powering artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 气候变化对飓风梅利莎的影响有多大
item.description:
一项新的分析表明，气候变化在多大程度上促成了破坏性风暴攀升至创纪录的水平。【原文：

A new analysis shows how much climate change contributed to the destructive storm’s climb into the record books.

】

item.title: 寻找超级污染物的卫星获得 1 亿美元新资助
item.description: 发现和阻止甲烷排放的工作获得了 1 亿美元的资金支持，这笔投资旨在扩大卫星监测范围，帮助各国制定政策，控制这种强效温室气体的排放。【原文：Work to find and stop methane emissions is getting a $100 million boost, with an investment aimed at expanding satellite monitoring and helping countries adopt policies to rein in releases of the potent greenhouse gas.】

item.title: 在 COP30 上，气候行动的经济逻辑有待商榷。
item.description: 世界各国领导人齐聚巴西贝伦，参加 COP30 气候谈判，但谈判将取得哪些成果？【原文：World leaders are gathering in Belem, Brazil, for the COP30 climate negotiations, but what will be achieved?】
